topic.para: The following procedure describes how to deploy &productnameshort; using the raw disk image.

step.para: Copy the decompressed image to the device where &productnameshort; will run:

The raw image comes with a default partitioning scheme (described in ). If you want to change it or perform complex configuration task, you need to prepare the configuration device as described in . Otherwise, you can proceed to the nex step.
Boot the raw image disk and in the boot loader screen select SLE Micro 6.0 and confirm with Enter.
Without the configuration device, the &jeosfirstboot; is triggered to perform minimal configuration. For details, refer to .
After successful deployment, register your system as described in.

note.title: Rerunning the initial configuration
note.para: You may invoke reconfiguration of the system on subsequent boot, by passing the ignition.firstboot attribute to the kernel command line or by deleting the file: /boot/writable/firstboot_happened. For more details regarding the first boot detectin refer to .
